idea-plugin.name: C/C++ Coverage
idea-plugin.change-notes:
2019.3.1:
Fixed Exception when using GCC 9 and an execution count exceeded 999 999. This was due to GCC switching to double inside of the JSON. Fixed here and by GCC 10.
Fixed some branch coverage inaccuracies in LLVM. Also improved branch coverage speed by up to 40%. Removed loop coverage from LLVM as it's simply incorrect and not useful.
Fixed calculated branch coverage of file to not take into account functions without branches. Functions without branches are now displayed as N/A instead of having 100% coverage.
Migrated off of project and application components internally. This will enable dynamic reloading of the plugin once CLion 2020 comes around.
idea-plugin.description:
C and C++ Line, Region and Branch Coverage gatherer for GCC and Clang. Automatically gathers line, region and branch coverage and displays it in editor and a statistic window. To use compile with --coverage and link against gcov when using GCC or compile with -fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping and use linker option -fprofile-instr-generate when using Clang.
For further details, known issues and differences of compilers see https://github.com/zero9178/GCoverage4CLion/blob/master/README.md
